articles.title: Kim Jong Il Enjoys Demonstration of Synchronized Swimming
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Enjoys Demonstration of Synchronized Swimming
						
Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il enjoyed a demonstration performance of synchronized swimming.
					 When he appeared at the gallery of the swimming pool of the Changgwang Health Complex, all the performers and spectators enthusiastically welcomed him with high tribute.
					
					 The performers presented dynamic movements and beautiful rhythms in such colorful numbers as duet synchronized swimming "Let's Sing of Our Pride in Being under the Guidance of the General", sextet synchronized swimming "It Is Offensive", solo synchronized swimming "Summer" and group synchronized swimming "We Sing of the Party".
					
					 They successfully represented the staunch spirit of Songun Korea dashing ahead like the wind toward the high peak of a great prosperous and powerful nation under the guidance of Kim Jong Il and powerfully demonstrated the daily developing synchronized swimming in the DPRK.
					
					 He acknowledged the enthusiastic cheers of the performers and the spectators and congratulated the players on their successful presentation. 
					
					 He expressed great satisfaction over the splendid synchronized swimming presented by them, highly appreciating their success and extending thanks to them.
					
					 He indicated orientation to further develop synchronized swimming and ways to do so. 
					
					 He set forth important tasks to serve as guidelines for rapidly developing the nation's sports, underscoring the need to round off sports technique and tactical system and training methods of Korean style to bring the level of sports technique to a higher stage.
					
					 Among the spectators were senior party, state and army officials Kim Jong Un, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Kim Kyong Hui, Kang Sok Ju, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, Kim Yang Gon, Pak To Chun, Choe Ryong Hae, Thae Jong Su, Mun Kyong Dok, Ju Kyu Chang, U Tong Chuk, Pak Myong Chol, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, Ri Ju Bong, chief secretary of the WPK Committee of the Ministry, and other officials concerned, servicepersons and officials in the fields of literature and arts and media.

articles.title: S. Korean Military Warmongers Urged to Halt Psywar against DPRK
articles.content:
S. Korean Military Warmongers Urged to Halt Psywar against DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- The anti-DPRK psychological warfare of the south Korean military warmongers has gone into extremes.
					 The puppet military warmongers are mulling bringing wicked conservative organizations to Paekryong Island on March 25 and 26 in a bid to let balloons containing hundreds of thousands of anti- DPRK leaflets, USBs on which corrupt animation files are recorded and foul one dollar notes, etc. to fly into the areas of the north side.  
					
					 They attempted to scatter leaflets from the Rimjin Pavilion with conservative non-governmental organizations involved early this month, too, only to be compelled to cancel their reckless plan in face of strong protest of progressive personages and inhabitants there. 
					
					 They are persistently getting frantic in scattering leaflets, even shifting the theatre for this operation in defiance of the north side's repeated warnings. This amounts to an official declaration that they remain unchanged in their policy of confrontation with the DPRK and are set to stand in showdown with it to the last. 
					
					 In this regard, the commander of forces of the Korean People's Army in the Western sector of the front, gave the following answer to a question put by KCNA on Wednesday: 
					
					 The KPA has already clarified its stand to blow up through sighting firings the bases for the anti-DPRK psychological warfare including the spots from which leaflets are scattered. 
					
					 This was because a psychological warfare precisely means a war action from a military viewpoint. 
					
					 Nevertheless, the puppet military warmongers are making persistent attempts to bring the above-said organizations to front areas to scatter leaflets. 
					
					 The KPA always keeps itself fully ready to make sighting firing and blow up those bases for the anti-DPRK psychological warfare not only in the Western sector of the front but in all areas along the front in order to cope with the puppet forces' madcap psychological warfare and go into action any time. 
					
					 If the puppet military warmongers do not want to draw the same lesson as taught by the Yonphyong Island shelling, they should immediately stop all the psychological warfares including the leaflet-scattering operations and behave with discretion.

articles.title: Togolese President Supports Korean People's Efforts for Reunification
articles.content:
Togolese President Supports Korean People's Efforts for Reunification
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- We are rejoiced over the big successes made by the Korean people in their efforts to build a thriving nation, said Togolese President Faure Essozimna Gnassingbe when receiving credentials from the DPRK ambassador to his country on Mar. 17.
					 The good relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries were provided by former President Eyadema and President Kim Il Sung, he said, adding:
					
					 Kim Il Sung is a great man recognized by the world. He gave much support and cooperation to Togo. 
					
					 It is our duty to carry forward the historic bilateral relations. 
					
					 We hope that the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation will continue to develop. 
					
					 We also hope that Korea will be reunified by federal formula and in a peaceful way through dialogue and negotiations. We support the Korean people's endeavors for peace on the Korean Peninsula and its reunification.

articles.title: Pakistani Ambassador to DPRK Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Pakistani Ambassador to DPRK Hosts Reception
						
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- Pakistani Ambassador to the DPRK Arif Mahmood gave a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club on Wednesday to mark the day of Pakistan. 
					 Present there on invitation were Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, Pak Kun Gwang, vice department director of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, and others and representatives of foreign embassies here.
					
					 Staff members of the Pakistani embassy were on hand.
					
					 Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: New Posters for Increased Grain Production Produced
articles.content:
New Posters for Increased Grain Production Produced 
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House produced posters encouraging the people of the country to bring about a great surge in agricultural production. 
					 A poster titled "Bring about a Great Innovation in Agricultural Production This Year!" depicts an agricultural worker determined to bring a rich harvest, helpers rushing to a socialist cooperative field and vehicles carrying farm materials, etc. It makes a successful ideological and artistic representation of the firm will of the Korean people to thoroughly implement the WPK's policy of agricultural revolution. 
					
					 A poster entitled "Bring about a Rich Harvest of First Crop!" calls for attaining the target of grain production without fail. It encourages the agricultural workers in their drive to achieve signal successes in the immediate spring farm work.

articles.title: New Book about Kim Jong Il Published
articles.content:
New Book about Kim Jong Il Published
						
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- Five-volume book "Comrade Kim Jong Il, Legendary Great Man" will be published on the occasion of his birthday in Juche 101 (2012). 
					 The Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House brought out its first volume "Great Philosopher".
					
					 It comprehensively deals with the great idea, leadership ability, exploits and traits of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The book has four chapters. 
					
					 The first chapter "The Genius Glorifying the Idea of the Times" deals with the greatness of Kim Jong Il who has made the immortal Juche idea founded by President Kim Il Sung shine as the guiding idea in the era of independence. 
					
					 The second chapter "Great Master of Political Philosophy" deals with the greatness of Kim Jong Il who regarded philosophy as a powerful weapon for putting socialist politics into practice. 
					
					 The third chapter "The Great Master of Popular Philosophy" tells about the leadership ability of Kim Jong Il who enunciated the philosophical idea pervaded with his warm love for people, giving every thought and making inquiries on the basis of his noble outlook on people and has armed the masses with it. 
					
					 The fourth chapter "Teacher Indicating the Road to Be Always Followed by Mankind" deals with the exploits performed by Kim Jong Il as a genius of philosophy who developed the Juche philosophy into an immortal idea visualizing the future of mankind.

articles.title: Climate Information Activities
articles.content:
Climate Information Activities
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- The Hydro-meteorological Service of the DPRK provides information about climate change on a regular basis.
					 The service, in cooperation with agricultural scientists, predicts the growth of crops to help agricultural farms throughout the country take necessary measures in farming.
					
					 It disseminates scientific and technological information, including yearly weather forecast, multimedia on the climate of Korea and agricultural e-map on climate.
					
					 It also informs relevant organs of possible high and low temperature, heavy rain, tidal wave and landslide so that they can carry on management activities on a scientific basis.
					
					 Meanwhile, mass media of the DPRK have provided people with knowledge of climatic change according to the theme of the World Meteorological Organization "Climate for You". March 23 is the World Meteorological Day.

articles.title: Brisk Preparations for Farming
articles.content:
Brisk Preparations for Farming
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- The rural areas of the DPRK are directing efforts to fully providing water for farming this year.  
					 Those in the irrigation field collected much water in reservoirs, securing 11 percent more water than last year.
					
					 Irrigation management stations in North Hwanghae Province and Pyongyang collected more water than planned. 
					
					 The people in Kaesong filled the reservoirs in the city. 
					
					 Repair and maintenance of pumping machines are also briskly underway. 
					
					 North and South Phyongan provinces worked out specific repair plans while giving precedence to the supply of necessary materials and accessories. 
					
					 They tapped all the internal reserves and actively conducted massive technical innovation movement, making success in repairing electric motors, transformers and other facilities.
					
					 South Hwanghae Province and Nampho City have almost finished the repair and maintenance of pumping equipment.

articles.title: Card Service for Restaurants
articles.content:
Card Service for Restaurants
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- A card service is available for restaurants in the Changgwang Street in Pyongyang. 
					 The card service centers provide menus of the restaurants and receive orders from people before giving them cards containing the names of restaurants and food they want.
					
					 They also let restaurants know about the orders through a computer network before people arrive at restaurants.
					
					 The doors of restaurants are opened by cards. When people enter restaurants, they find their food is ready.

articles.title: New Fondue Cookery Developed
articles.content:
New Fondue Cookery Developed
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- Central Cooking School in Pyongyang has invented a new method of preparing fondue, a Swiss traditional dish. 
					 Fondue is usually prepared with cow cheese and white wine.
					
					 But the school prepares it with goat cheese and Taedonggang beer produced in the DPRK. 
					
					 The school proved in a scientific and theoretical way that goat cheese can be used for fondue and that Taedonggang beer is better than white wine in melting cheese.
					
					 It also standardized the new method.
					
					 Fondue prepared by the new method is excellent in taste, color and fragrance and is easy to make at restaurants and households.

articles.title: Trite Method of Invasion
articles.content:
Trite Method of Invasion
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- Surprise attack is a favorite method employed by the United States in invading other nations.
					 Through surprise attack the United States seeks to neutralize other side's military equipment and expand the operation theatre.
					
					 In 1950 it instigated south Korea to launch a surprise attack on the DPRK at dawn on a Sunday. But the Korean war brought about the beginning of a downhill turn for U.S. imperialism.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists, availing themselves of Grenada's complicated situation, attacked the country suddenly on the early morning of October 25, 1983, and occupied it.
					
					 They employed the same method on December 20, 1989 to invade Panama.
					
					 The Key Resolve and Foal Eagle military maneuvers started by the United States with south Korea are a product of their anti-DPRK policy and part of their preparations for another Korean war.

articles.title: KNA Formed by Kim Hyong Jik
articles.content:
KNA Formed by Kim Hyong Jik
						
Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Hyong Jik, an indomitable revolutionary fighter, formed the Korean National Association (KNA) on March 23, Juche 6 (1917).
					 With a view that the nation's independence should be achieved by the Korean people themselves, he determined to conduct activities for rallying and awakening the people.
					
					 He thought that for that purpose, an anti-Japanese underground organization was necessary along with hard-core members and the mass foundation.
					
					 He conducted energetic activities for laying the mass foundation in many areas of the country.
					
					 When the conditions were mature for founding the organization, he convened a preliminary meeting to discuss the name and inauguration of the organization.
					
					 After making full preparations, he formed the KNA in Hakdanggol, Pyongyang.
					
					 Addressing the inaugural meeting, he set it as the goal of the KNA to win the independence of the nation and build a genuine, civilized country with concerted efforts of the Korean people. 
					
					After the inauguration, the KNA was rapidly expanded throughout the country.

articles.title: ITAR-TASS Introduces Operas of DPRK
articles.content:
ITAR-TASS Introduces Operas of DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- ITAR-TASS introduced on March 18 the five revolutionary operas of the DPRK created under the guidance of Kim Jong Il. It said:
					 Opera "The Story of a Nurse" was staged at the Pyongyang Grand Theater in the DPRK. 
					
					 "Where Are You, Dear General?", a song the Koreans often sing in solo or chorus, is the theme song of the opera.  
					
					 The opera tells a story about a nurse who remained faithful to the Workers' Party of Korea and President Kim Il Sung till the last moments of her life in the period of the 1950-1953 Fatherland Liberation War. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il brought about a radical turn in opera, breaking the stereotyped style that had long been deterring the development of opera. 
					
					 Masterpiece "The Sea of Blood" was adapted as opera under his energetic guidance to raise its curtain in July 1971.
					
					 Afterwards, he guided the creation of four other famous operas "The Story of a Nurse", "Tell O Forest", "The Flower Girl" and "Song of Mt. Kumgang". These are called the five revolutionary operas in the DPRK.

articles.title: Anniversary of Center for Consulting Marriage of Koreans in Japan
articles.content:
Anniversary of Center for Consulting Marriage of Koreans in Japan
						
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- It is one of the important principles adhered to by the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) in its activities to preserve the national character. 
					 Chongryon set up the Center for Consulting Marriage of Korean Youth in Japan on March 23, 1994, in order to give continuity to the tradition of the nation by helping more Koreans in Japan realize their marriages.
					
					 The Center has a well-regulated system of local centers and prefectural matrimonial advice offices.
					
					 It has conducted positive activities to preserve national character despite the Japanese reactionaries' undisguised moves against the DPRK and Chongryon over the past period.
					
					 Chongryon, regarding the issue of marriage between Koreans as an important matter of Korean families and Korean community, has exerted efforts to motivate in every way all organizations and matrimonial advice offices for Koreans in Tokyo and local areas of Japan to help as many Korean boys and girls as possible in getting married.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary on S. Korea's Introduction of War Hardware from US
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary on S. Korea's Introduction of War Hardware from US 
						
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities are showing increased zeal for introducing war hardware from the U.S.
					 The stepped-up moves to induct U.S.-made weapons into the south Korean puppet army are an inevitable product of the common aims sought by the U.S. and the south Korean group of traitors to ignite a new war on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 According to a report released by the Stockholm International Peace Research Institute on Mar. 14, U.S.-made weapons accounted for 71 percent of the arms introduced by south Korea from abroad between 2006 and 2010. 
					
					 This year, too, the south Korean military authorities deployed F-15K fighters, each having 1 800km radius of operation, in the air force again, bringing their  number to dozens. They are mulling introducing AWACS Boeing E-737 with a huge financial allocation in July. 
					
					 This is obviously an unpardonable military provocation to the DPRK and a hideous criminal act of driving the situation on the peninsula to the brink of war. 
					
					 What merits a more serious attention is that the U.S. and south Korean warmongers are further intensifying their provocations against the DPRK, talking about "contingency" of someone. 
					
					 It is the scenario of the U.S. to train the south Korean puppet forces by American-style in terms of ideology, morality, arms and equipment and all other aspects and use them as a shock brigade for igniting a new war. 
					
					 The military authorities of south Korea are busy massively deploying U.S.-made latest nuclear war hardware and precision and air strike weapons to hold a "military edge" over the DPRK. 
					
					 The massive introduction of U.S.-made weapons is aimed to serve the purpose of the U.S. to start the second Korean war with south Korea as a springboard and that of its stooge south Korean authorities to spark a fratricidal war in league with it. 
					
					 Unpardonable is the massive induction of U.S.-made weapons to the south Korean puppet forces as it is a grave political and military provocative act of threatening peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula and the rest of the Asia-Pacific region and increasing danger of a new war.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Terms US New "National Military Strategy" Dangerous
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Terms US New "National Military Strategy" Dangerous 
						
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- The United States recently made public its new "national military strategy". In the strategy, it claimed its military target is to counter "violent radicalism," and "deter and beat back" somebody's "aggression" in a bid to consolidate the "international and regional security".
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a bylined article in this regard: 
					
					 This indicates that the U.S. is still pursuing its wild ambition for dominating the world and seeking to realize it through high-handed military actions. 
					
					 The said strategy is nothing but a doctrine of aggression to justify the U.S. interference in the internal affairs of other countries and its military aggression against them and disturb regional security and peace and spark a new arms race in league with its allied forces under the pretext of tightening the military alliance. 
					
					 The "strengthening of international and regional security" much touted by the U.S. precisely means interference in the internal affairs of other countries and military aggression against them. In the past the U.S. unhesitatingly meddled in the internal affairs of other countries incurring its displeasure under the pretext of "human rights" and "democracy" and used force of arms to put them under their control in the end. 
					
					 By deliberately straining the situation in the Asia-Pacific region the U.S. seeks to get the countries in the region embroiled in the arms race in a bid to obstruct their stable socio-economic development and spark a new Cold War. 
					
					 The Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises staged by the U.S. recently together with the south Korean puppet forces bring into bolder relief the aggressive nature and danger of the strategy. 
					
					 All these facts eloquently prove that the said strategy is a dangerous doctrine of aggression aiming to realize its ambition for dominating the world and the U.S. is an arch criminal disturbing the peace and security of the world and the root cause of straining the regional situation.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Policy of Confrontation with DPRK Rebuffed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Policy of Confrontation with DPRK Rebuffed
						
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, south Korean Minister of Unification Hyon In Thaek talked nonsense that it has pursued a "principled policy toward the north" based on "no-nuke, opening and 3 000 dollars" for the past three years and this "will be a landmark turning point in unification" in the future. Later, he blustered that the ministry is "working hard for dialogue, cooperation, peace and unification", claiming that there can be no other discussion as someone's "denuclearization and opening" are the "core tasks for peace" and a "main target of the policy toward the north".
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in a bylined article in this regard:
					
					 The above-said reckless remarks prove that the south Korean authorities are making desperate efforts to justify, preserve and implement at any cost their "policy toward the north" which brought the inter-Korean relations to collapse.
					
					 The said policy can never be justified under any circumstances.
					
					 It is an out-and-out theory aimed at carrying out the U.S. sinister scenario to do harm to the fellow countrymen under the pretext of the nuclear issue.
					
					 The nuclear issue of the Korean Peninsula is not one between the north and the south but one between the DPRK and the U.S. as it was spawned by the U.S.
					
					 The south Korean authorities' "policy towards the north" is designed to realize their ambition for achieving "unification under liberal democracy" in total denial of the basic spirit of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, great programmes for the development of inter-Korean relations and national reunification. 
					
					 It is a dangerous policy escalating the tensions on the peninsula and bringing the danger of war.
					
					 The south Korean authorities are so foolish to work hard to carry out the already bankrupt policy.

articles.title: S. Korean "Government" Accused of Sidestepping Issue of Registration Fee
articles.content:
S. Korean "Government" Accused of Sidestepping Issue of Registration Fee 
						
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- The Youth and Students Solidarity for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration in south Korea in a statement on March 19 denounced the authorities for sidestepping the issue of registration fee. 
					 After the emergence of the present "government" the registration fee jumped at universities to become a serious social problem, the statement noted, adding:
					
					 The present authorities came to power by winning public favor with the promise to cut down the registration fee by half, but they claim that they have never discussed such a matter. 
					
					 There is nothing to be expected from the "government" deceiving people, the statement said, calling upon the students and their parents to judge the treacherous "government" pursuing a policy against education, a policy for the rich, in order to put an end to their sufferings.

articles.title: Karachi Juche Study Center Opens to Public
articles.content:
Karachi Juche Study Center Opens to Public
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- The Karachi Juche Study Center of Pakistan was opened with due ceremony on March 18. 
					On display at the Center are works of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and photos on their undying feats.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were the deputy speaker of the Assembly of Sind State and members of organizations for the study of the Juche idea and friendship and solidarity with the Korean people.
					
					 A delegation of the Social Scientist Society of Korea was on hand. 
					
					 The participants voiced their will to properly operate the Center through diverse forms and methods so as to contribute to the study and dissemination of the Juche idea.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Politics of Love Praised
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Politics of Love Praised
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- The International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions posted on Internet website an article titled "People-loving politics" on Mar. 18 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 The article said that the world people admire the DPRK in which the people are taken good care of. 
					
					 It went on:
					
					 Kim Il Sung, father of socialist Korea, translated into reality the ideal of humankind by pursuing the politics of loving and trusting the people for the first time in history. 
					
					 There was an oven of first-stage iron-procession equipped with backward technical facilities and poor safety arrangements in a steel works in the northeastern area of Korea. It was built by Japan before the liberation of Korea.
					
					 The President said that the workers' lives are more precious than anything else though steel is badly needed. He instructed to blow up the oven to the full. 
					
					 When geologists discovered a vein of gold in the area of Mt. Myohyang, he let them stop developing a gold mine for the sake of the beauty of the famous mountain loved by the people. 
					
					 There were many other steps taken by him with top priority given to the people's life and happiness.

articles.title: Seminars Held Abroad to Mark DPRK Anniversaries
articles.content:
Seminars Held Abroad to Mark DPRK Anniversaries 
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- Seminars were held in the Czech Republic and Nigeria on Mar. 10 and 17. 
					 They were to commemorate President Kim Il Sung's birth anniversary, the 18th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and the 79th birthday of the Korean People's Army. 
					
					 The struggle of the Korean people to liberate the nation and build a new society and socialism is associated with the august name of President Kim Il Sung, said Miroslav Stepan, general secretary of the C.C., the Czechoslovak Communist Party (CCP). 
					
					The CCP has General Secretary Kim Jong Il as its honorary member, the general secretary said, declaring that the Party would always extend full support and solidarity to the leader's cause, the cause of the Korean people for socialism and national reunification no matter which way the wind may blow.
					
					 Ahmed Blaza Lawan, chairman of the Nigerian Group for the Study of the Songun Politics, detailed the contents of Kim Jong Il's work "On Preserving the Juche Character and National Character of the Revolution and Construction" and its significance.

articles.title: Aftershocks Continue and Radiation Gets Serious in Japan
articles.content:
Aftershocks Continue and Radiation Gets Serious in Japan 
						
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- Strong aftershocks are occurring one after another in the wake of the devastating quake that hit Japan on March 11. 
					 A magnitude 6.0 quake jolted Fukushima Prefecture Wednesday morning. 
					
					 NHK reported that there were 25 aftershocks of magnitude 2.0-6.3 from 22:23 of Monday to 17:33 of Tuesday. 
					
					 Damage caused by the killer quake and ensuing tsunami is expanding while social unrest is on the increase due to ceaseless aftershocks. 
					
					The death toll reached 9 301 and the number of the people reported missing climbed to 13,786 as of 09:00 Wednesday, said the National Police Agency, adding that this is the worst disaster since the great earthquake in Kanto.
					
					Some 130,000 houses were damaged in the quake-hit areas.
					
					240,000 inhabitants are left without the supply of water and electricity does not yet reach 221,000 families.
					
					 In the meantime the radiation caused by the explosions at the Fukushima nuclear power plant does not show any sign of improvement. 
					
					 Experts were of the views that Reactor No. 3 among the six reactors of the plant was fraught with the most potential danger because the meltdown of its core might cause the leakage of highly poisonous plutonium.
					
					 Reactor No. 4 is in the same dangerous state as all the fuel rods are fully exposed in the reactor. 
					
					Radiation 1,600 times higher than normal levels has been detected in an area about 20 kilometers from the crippled Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant, the International Atomic Energy Agency said Monday in a survey.
					
					 It was reported that radioactive materials three times the normal level were detected from the drinking water in a populated area near the power plant that day. 
					
					 Radioactive iodine at levels 127 times higher than the legal concentration limit and radioactive cesium 25 times higher were detected in seawater near the water discharging outlets of the Fukushima nuclear power plant on Tuesday.
					
					 The World Health Organization expressed concern that radioactive substances contained in foods might be accumulated in human bodies, urging the Japanese authorities to stop selling foods contaminated by radiation.

articles.title: Japan's Design of Nuclear Power Plant Criticized by Russian Expert
articles.content:
Japan's Design of Nuclear Power Plant Criticized by Russian Expert 
						
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- An expert in nuclear power plant of Russia criticized Japan's design of nuclear power plant in a recent interview with Reuters. 
					 Referring to the fire that broke out at Reactor No. 4 of the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant, he said that its design was "a specific example showing that Japan attached greater importance to the economic interests than safety."
					
					 He held that in case fuel is stored in the spent fuel rod tank in high density like in Japan, there is great possibility of fire if the tank runs out of water.

articles.title: Russian President Calls for Bolstering Armed Forces
articles.content:
Russian President Calls for Bolstering Armed Forces
 Moscow, March 21 (KCNA) -- Russian President Dmitri Medvedev, addressing a meeting on Mar. 18, called for bolstering the country's armed forces. 
					 Russia will establish the unified aerospace defence system this year, he said. He underlined the need to combine this system with the existing air and missile defense systems, missile early warning system and space surveillance system so as to hold unified control of them.
					
					 He said that it is a permanent task to reliably defend the country's boundary, emphasizing the need to reorganize the infrastructure for the defence of the Far Eastern region of Russia. 
					
					 He called for beefing up the officers' group of the federal armed forces.

articles.title: Russia Rejects Japan's Concern
articles.content:
Russia Rejects Japan's Concern
 Moscow, March 21 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the Security and Defence Committee of the Russian Federal Assembly at a meeting with diplomats on Mar. 18 brushed aside Japan's concern.
					 He said he does not agree with the concern expressed by the Japanese side over Russia's bolstering of military potential in the Kuriles including the deployment of C-300 and C-400 there.
					
					 He clarified that Russia has an intention to deploy these missile complexes in the Far Eastern region but it has nothing to do with the Kuriles.

articles.title: Earthquake Shakes Kamchatka Territory
articles.content:
Earthquake Shakes Kamchatka Territory 
 Moscow, March 21 (KCNA) -- A 5-magnitude quake rattled Olryutorski District in Kamchatka Territory of Russia on March 18.
					 The epicenter was 33 kilometers away from Tsilrichiki.

articles.title: Reform of Judicial System Called for in Russia
articles.content:
Reform of Judicial System Called for in Russia
						
 Moscow, March 21 (KCNA) -- Sergei Mironov, chairman of the Russian Federal Assembly, at a recent press conference called for the fundamental reform of the judicial system.
					 He said that letters and appeals from many Russians show that the majority of the people are discontented with Russia's judicial system.
					
					 It is necessary for the state to pay attention to this issue and reform the system, he said.

articles.title: Brazilian President Censures US Protectionism
articles.content:
Brazilian President Censures US Protectionism
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- Brazilian President Dilma Vana Rousseff denounced the U.S. protectionism.
					 At a diplomatic gathering on Mar. 19 she accused the U.S. of imposing protectionist barriers on Brazilian goods. She branded this as a selfish action to rid only the U.S. of the financial crisis.
					
					 This compels other countries to take their own countermeasures, she said.
					
					 She called for building fair and equal trade relations.

articles.title: Pakistan Seeks US Apology over Drone Strike
articles.content:
Pakistan Seeks US Apology over Drone Strike
						
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- The Foreign Ministry of Pakistan denounced the U.S. deadly drone strike. 
					 In a statement on March 17 it said that the U.S. drone aircraft fired missiles Thursday, killing at least 40 innocent civilians in the country's northwest tribal area of North Waziristan. This is not only unacceptable but also a flagrant violation of all humanitarian rules and norms. 
					
					 The statement demanded that the U.S. hold full responsibility and make an apology.

articles.title: Belorussian PM on Boosting Cooperation in Customs
articles.content:
Belorussian PM on Boosting Cooperation in Customs
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- Mikhail Myasnikovich, prime minister of Belarus, at a recent press conference referred to boosting cooperation among the member nations of the Customs Union.
					 He underscored the need for them to positively support one another while expanding cooperation in production.

articles.title: 9th Congress of Lao Party Held
articles.content:
9th Congress of Lao Party Held 
yongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- The 9th Congress of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party (LPRP) was held in Vientiane from Mar. 17 to 21.
					 Choummaly Saynasone, general secretary of the C.C., the LPRP, delivered a political report at the congress.
					
					 He referred to the successes gained in the past five years since the 8th Congress of the Party and set forth its new tasks.
					
					 The political report and a report on the modification of party rules were adopted at the congress. It set forth the goal for 2011-2015 economic and social development of Laos and tasks to be fulfilled by 2020.
					
					 New leadership organ of the C.C., the LPRP was elected at the congress.

articles.title: Iran Bolsters Air Force
articles.content:
Iran Bolsters Air Force
Tehran, March 21 (CNA) -- Iran is steadily directing efforts to bolstering its air force.
					 A high-ranking officer of the Iranian military on March 19 said that a squadron of home-made fighter "Saeqeh" (thunderbolt) was put into commission in the air force.
					
					 He said that Iran succeeded in mass-producing the fighter fitted with sophisticated equipment.

articles.title: Iran Steadfast in Nuclear Activities
articles.content:
Iran Steadfast in Nuclear Activities
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- Iran has bolstered up defense capabilities and strengthened bilateral relations with neighboring nations, steadfastly defending its rights to nuclear activities for a peaceful purpose.
					 Some time ago, two military vessels of Iran navigated to Syria through the Suez Canal and the Mediterranean. The navigation was a drill and part of cooperation with Syria.
					
					 Iran made a home-manufactured self-propelled howitzer open to the public.
					
					 It also plans to manufacture latest-type fighters.
					
					 The sanctions imposed on Iran by the United States and other western nations have become ineffective with the Islamic country trying to back its nuclear program with strong defense capabilities.
					
					 Admittedly, the confrontation between Iran and the United States will continue over the nuclear issue.
					
					 The United States is seeking to isolate Iran internationally under the pretext of the nuclear issue but it is worried about many countries having different views in the way of solving the nuclear issue.

articles.title: Nigeria to Increase Power Generation
articles.content:
Nigeria to Increase Power Generation
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- Nigeria plans to increase annual power generation to 40 000 megawatts by 2020.
					 This requires the appropriation of huge funds for the power field.
					
					 The current annual power generation of Nigeria is 4,000 megawatts.

articles.title: Heightened Vigilance Called for in Cuba
articles.content:
Heightened Vigilance Called for in Cuba
 Havana, March 21 (KCNA) -- The Cuban Committee for the Defense of the Revolution (CDR) in its statement on Mar. 19 called on its members to enhance the revolutionary people's vigilance against the acts of vandalism affecting different sectors of the Cuban economy. 
					 "The actions against the public telephony and transportation, the theft of railway sleepers and rails, and of the angle of electrical towers, among others, endanger human life, affect the country's economy and hurt the public peace," the statement said. 
					
					 "The people at the CDR, the Federation of Cuban Women and the National Association of Small Farmers have all the means to combat the social indisciplines and to give an effective response in preventing or fighting the serious crimes against the communications, transportation, electricity and rail systems," it added.

articles.title: China to Found New University
articles.content:
China to Found New University
						
 Beijing, March 21 (KCNA) -- The Qinghai Provincial People's Government and the State Nationalities Affairs Commission of China recently signed in Beijing an agreement on founding Qinghai National University.
					 According to it, the commission is to render help including the long-term development plan, education management, cooperation in scientific research, building of teachers' ranks and training of talented students at the university.
					
					 The Qinghai Provincial People's Government is to bolster guidance over the university and seek timely solution to the issues arising in its development.

articles.title: Faure Essozimna apoya lucha de pueblo coreano
articles.content:
Faure Essozimna apoya lucha de pueblo coreano 
						
Pyongyang, 23 de marzo (ATCC) -- El nuevo embajador coreano en Togo entrego el 17 sus cartas credenciales al presidente de este pais, Faure Essozimna Gnassingbe.
					En la ocasion, Faure senalo que se alegra mucho de que el pueblo coreano haya logrado grandes exitos en la lucha por construir una gran potencia prospera, y continuo:
					
					Las excelentes relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre ambos paises fueron preparadas por el ex Presidente Eyadema y el Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					
					El Presidente Kim Il Sung es el gran hombre reconocido por todo el mundo que ayudo y brindo mucha colaboracion para Togo.
					
					Deviene nuestro deber desarrollar las historicas relaciones bilaterales.
					
					Esperamos que se desarrollen continuamente las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises.
					
					Deseamos que Corea se reunifique de modo federativo y por via pacifica mediante el dialogo y las negociaciones, y apoyamos los esfuerzos del pueblo coreano por lograr la paz y la reunificacion de la Peninsula Coreana.

articles.title: ATCC comenta ambicion agresiva de EE.UU. y Sur de Corea
articles.content:
ATCC comenta ambicion agresiva de EE.UU. y Sur de Corea
						
Pyongyang, 23 de marzo (ATCC) -- Se tornan cada dia mas abiertas las maniobras del Sur de Corea para armar el ejercito titere con los armamentos norteamericanos. 
					Esto es el producto inevitable de la coincidencia de la ambicion de agresion de EE.UU., que intenta provocar la segunda guerra coreana, y de la banda traidora surcoreana. 
					
					  Segun el informe publicado el 14 de marzo por el Instituto Internacional de la Paz en Estocolmo, las armas de fabricacion norteamericana ocuparon el 71 por ciento de los armamentos importados por el Sur de Corea desde 2006 hasta 2010.
					
					  Este ano tambien las autoridades militares del Sur de Corea volvieron a emplazar en sus fuerzas aereas los aviones de combate "F-15K" con mil 800 km de radio operacional, con los que suman decenas los cazas del mismo tipo. Y en julio introduciran "Boeing E-737", aparato conocido como "comando del cielo". 
					
					   Tales maniobras devienen intolerable provocacion militar contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y acto criminal que lleva la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana al borde de la guerra. 
					
					  Lo mas grave del caso es que la importacion de armas norteamericanas por parte del Sur de Corea coincide con las provocaciones a la RPDC que se cometen bajo el pretexto de la "situacion emergente" de esta. 
					
					  EE.UU. pretende utilizar el ejercito titere surcoreano como brigada de choque de la provocacion de la nueva guerra, al armarlo completamente al estilo norteamericano desde la ideologia y el espiritu hasta los armamentos. 
					
					  En tanto, las autoridades militares surcoreanas tratan de tomar la "supremacia militar" sobre la RPDC mediante la ubicacion de los equipos y materiales ultramodernos de guerra nuclear y los armamentos de ataque aereo a precision. 
					
					  Por lo tanto, no pueden ser toleradas nunca estas graves provocaciones politicas y militares que amenazan la paz y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana y el resto de la region de Asia-Pacifico y agrandan el peligro de nueva guerra.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun vuelve a condenar la politica conflictiva del Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun vuelve a condenar la politica conflictiva del Sur de Corea
						
Pyongyang, 23 de marzo (ATCC) -- Hace poco, el ministro de Reunificacion del Sur de Corea, Hyon In Thaek, peroro en una ceremonia que la parte surcoreana vino promoviendo durante 3 anos la "politica sobre el Norte de principios" basada en la doctrina de "desnuclearizacion, la apertura, 3000 dolares" y esto "sera en el futuro el punto de viraje trascendental en la reunificacion".
					Poco despues, dijo que ellos estan esforzandose por el "dialogo, la cooperacion, la paz y la reunificacion" y destaco que la "desnuclearizacion y apertura al extranjero" del Norte es indiscutible porque es la "tarea nuclear por la paz" y la "meta fundamental de la politica sobre el Norte".
					
					Esto demuestra que las autoridades surcoreanas justifican su "politica sobre el Norte" que llevo las relaciones intercoreanas a la ruptura y actuan freneticamente para mantenerla y realizarla a toda costa.
					
					Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual difundido este miercoles y continua:
					
					No se puede justificar en ningun caso la "politica sobre el Norte" de las autoridades surcoreanas.
					
					Esta politica es la teoria de servilismo a grandes potencias basada en el malsano proposito de EE.UU. de atacar a la connacional RPDC bajo el pretexto del problema nuclear.
					
					El problema nuclear de la Peninsula Coreana surgido por culpa de EE.UU. no es el entre ambas partes coreanas sino el entre la RPDC y EE.UU.
					
					La politica de las autoridades surcoreanas es para negar completamente el espiritu principal de la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y la Declaracion del 4 de Octubre, programas por el desarrollo de las relaciones intercoreanas y la reunificacion de la patria, y realizar la ambicion de "reunificar bajo el sistema democratico liberal".
					
					Tambien es la guerrerista que agrava la tension de la Peninsula Coreana y trae el peligro de guerra.
					
					Es absurdo que las autoridades surcoreanas intenten implementar a toda costa su "politica sobre el Norte" ya fracasada.

articles.title: Actividades de servicio informatico frente al cambio climatico
articles.content:
Actividades de servicio informatico frente al cambio climatico
						
Pyongyang, 23 de marzo (ATCC) -- La Direccion Meteorologica e Hidrologica de Corea libra las dinamicas actividades del servicio informatico frente a la mutacion climatica.
					  Pronostica el crecimiento de los cultivos en cooperacion con los cientificos agricolas para que las granjas del pais tomen las medidas tecnicas conforme a las previstas condiciones meteorologicas y climaticas.
					
					  Divulga los datos cientifico-tecnicos como multimedia "Coleccion de datos del clima de Corea", el mapa electronico "Mapa detallado del clima para la agricultura" y la informacion climatica anual.
					
					  Especialmente, para las unidades correspondientes, realiza a tiempo el pronostico de los fenomenos meteorologicos que traen los desastres como la alta temperatura anormal, la baja anormal, la inundacion, la marejada y el derrumbe de la montana.
					
					  Ademas, envia a varias ramas de la economia nacional elaborando los valores estandarizados del clima para que ellas realicen las actividades de gestion en base cientifica.
					
					  Por otra parte, con motivo del Dia Mundial de la Meteorologia (hoy), en Corea se desarrolla el trabajo para informar a los habitantes los conocimientos elementales alusivos al cambio climatico conforme al tema presentado por la Organizacion Meteorologica Mundial (OMM), "Clima para Usted".

articles.title: Instituto de Plantas Decorativas de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Instituto de Plantas Decorativas de Pyongyang
						
Pyongyang, 23 de marzo (ATCC) -- Ultimamente, concurren muchos habitantes al Instituto de Plantas Decorativas de Pyongyang.
					  Desde cuando el Dirigente Kim Jong Il lo dirigio sobre el terreno hasta la fecha, fue visitado por miles de mas de cien entidades.
					
					  Entre ellos figuran los funcionarios de ministerios y organos centrales como el Comite Estatal de Planificacion y el Ministerio de Agricultura, las entidades de reforestacion y cultivo de arboleda de todas las provincias y ciudades y los aficionados a las plantas decorativas.
					
					  Los visitantes escuchan las experiencias prestando mucha atencion a la investigacion cientifica y las actividades de administracion del instituto.
					
					  Especialmente, aprenden la tecnica de cultivo de flores y los datos de referencia.
					
					  Este instituto tiene invernaderos modernos donde todos los procesos de trabajo como la regulacion de temperatura y humedad se realizan automaticamente por la computadora.
					
					  Alli se cultivan y se mejoran las variedades de las flores hermosas y aromaticas que crecen en Corea y varias regiones del mundo.
					
					  En los ultimos dias, los cientificos y tecnicos del instituto establecieron el metodo de reproduccion de las plantas decorativas por el cultivo del tejido y resolvieron muchos problemas cientifico-tecnicos, de manera que se abrieran las posibilidades de registrar el cambio trascendental en la produccion de flores.
